{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3688482,"name":"Goktug Yildiz","username":"goktugyldz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/bc79bd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-24T10:41:15.900Z","cooked":"

Hi CD,
we were using YAGSL for our 2025 comp bot but since it is not available for Systemcore we are trying to get 364’s code working. We are running into a issue where only front right module follows the joystick. The back modules do not follow our joysticks movement when we move our joystick forward the wheels move to sideways. What could be the error that we could make in the code. We checked the cancoders offset’s many times.
We have 4 x Mk4iL2, 4x Cancoders, 1x Pigeon2 and 8x NEO’s.

github.com

GitHub - Alone1206/8795-SC

Contribute to Alone1206/8795-SC development by creating an account on GitHub.

We measured offsets with all wheel bevel gears facing to left side of the robot. When joystick is pushed forward back wheels point to right and turn forward while front wheels point forward and go forward(front left module sometimes decide to point at random directions). Strangely enough front right module follows the joystick perfectly every time.
Swerve works as intended with yagsl on roborio with the same module configs.

I could make a version for you that works with system core if you tell me what hardware you’re using. You could have asked in Discord as well.

Discord

Join the YAGSL Discord Server!

Community dedicated to raising the floor for all FIRST Robotics Competition teams, and FIRST Tech Challenge teams through the advancement of common libraries and code generators. | 596 members

We have 4 x Mk4i L2, 4 x Cancoders, 1x Pigeon2 and 8x NEOs. Discord is banned in Turkey, but @goktugyldz do you have a VPN to visit their Discord server?
